alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 2:17PM MST until December 28 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow and patchy blowing snow above 4500 feet. Snow may mix with rain at times below 4500-5000 feet and will be all rain below 4000 feet. New snow accumulations generally ranging from 2 to 4 inches, with lesser amounts below 5000 feet and locally higher amounts above 6000 feet. Southwest winds gusting to near 35 mph at times, leading to patchy blowing snow. * WHERE...Areas above 4500 feet near Chino Valley, Paulden, Prescott Valley, and Sedona. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Slippery and snow covered roads could lead to very difficult travel across the high terrain. Patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility at times. Hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Additional snow forecast through 11 PM Tonight: Chino Valley 0 to 1 inches. Paulden 0 to 1 inches. Prescott Valley 1 to 2 inches. Sedona 0 to 1 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
